title: ACCC grants interim authorisation to allow Battery Stewardship Scheme to continue with limited levy and rebate adjustments
summary: The ACCC has granted interim authorisation with a condition to the Battery Stewardship Council (BSC) to continue operating the Battery Stewardship Scheme with a limited adjustment of the Scheme’s levy and rebates.

title: Clorox ordered to pay $8.25m in penalties for misleading 'ocean plastic' claims about certain GLAD products
summary: The Federal Court today ordered Clorox Australia Pty Ltd (Clorox) to pay a total penalty of $8.25 million for making false or misleading representations to consumers that certain GLAD kitchen and garbage bags were partly made of recycled ‘ocean plastic’, following court action by the ACCC.

title: Retail pricing, merger reform implementation and competition issues among ACCC's 2025-26 priorities
summary: Retail pricing, merger reform implementation and competition issues among ACCC’s 2025-26 priorities

title: ACCC releases final guide on sustainability collaborations
summary: The ACCC has today released its final guide on sustainability collaborations and Australian competition law.

title: ACCC proposes to authorise flooring recycling scheme
summary: The ACCC is proposing to grant authorisation for ResiLoop to establish and operate a voluntary, industry-led product stewardship scheme (the Scheme) that collects and recycles resilient flooring waste.

title: ACCC consulting on guide to sustainability collaborations
summary: The ACCC has today published a draft guide on sustainability collaborations and Australian competition law.

title: Rain kept water availability high across the Murray-Darling Basin
summary: Wet conditions across the Murray-Darling Basin in 2022-23 kept water availability high, while regulated water charges varied substantially, reflecting the different tariff structures and approaches to cost recovery taken by each Basin State, the ACCC’s annual water monitoring report shows.

title: Emerging technology risks among ACCC product safety priorities
summary: Risks associated with the use of emerging technology in consumer products such as lithium-ion battery powered products and virtual reality products will be a key focus of the ACCC’s product safety priorities

title: ACCC proposes to reauthorise Tyre Product Stewardship Scheme
summary: The ACCC is proposing to grant authorisation for the Tyre Product Stewardship scheme to continue for a further 3 years.

title: GLAD bags manufacturer in court for '50% ocean plastic' claims
summary: The ACCC has instituted proceedings in the Federal Court against Clorox Australia Pty Ltd, the manufacturer of GLAD-branded kitchen and garbage bags, for allegedly making false or misleading representations that certain kitchen and garbage bags were partly made of recycled ‘ocean plastic’, in breach of the Australian Consumer Law.
